TopicTitle: Destination: Mun, a stock 50s rocket replica

Articles.Content:
I have a bit of an obsession with retro-futuristic spacecraft, so I thought I'd have a crack at replicating the "Luna rocketship" from the 1950 film "Destination: Moon".

Spoiler

In the film the craft takes off vertically, flies to the moon and back in a single stage and then lands vertically; due to stock part limitations this version has to be boosted into orbit with a rocket and lands like a space plane. But unlike the film version this one has excess fuel (5km/s of Delta-V) so you could even do interplanetary missions!

Steam Workshop: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=16645450

Google Drive: https://drive.google.com/open?id=18kpuXP6hVcmdnW504kqev5w1q_T2pAy1

Edited February 24, 2019 by Ol’ Musky Boi
Post it on KerbalX would be better, at least for this forum, since to download Steam crafts you need to login with a Steam version KSP.

16 hours ago, Jestersage said:

Post it on KerbalX would be better, at least for this forum, since to download Steam crafts you need to login with a Steam version KSP.

Thanks for the suggestion, I don't have a KerbalX profile and to be honest I'm too lazy to make one atm so I just added the raw file.
